bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, August 20, 1900

div1.p: Lazear writes about family plans. He is now working on malaria, and says yellow fever is decreasing in Havana.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, August 20, 1900
div1.p:
I was glad
to get your letter of Aug
12. and to know you
when having cooler
weather. It has
continued hot in Baltimore

I hope Mabel will
be able to go to Annisquam
after the event and I
think three weeks at
the hospital will be
long enough. She would
pick up better at Annisquam
But I hope it will
not be necessary for
you to go somewhere
else. Cant you all
arrange to crowd in
somehow.

It is still rather
warm here but I
get a good many
sea baths which I
enjoy very much.

I shall probably not
be able to get away
until late in October
but then is plenty of
time for making plans
later on. My work is now more
on malaria which I had been
looking forward to. Yellow fever
is decreasing in Havana and
then is none at all here.
Do you hear any news from Pittsburgh
and Baltimore?

I enjoy the Bookman. It is always
interesting. One wisers the library.
Give my love to little Houston.

I am curious as to how he will
behave when I came.
